STAT207 Course Assistant, UIUC

2023 — present

● Assisted in designing and delivering instructional materials for more than 30 students related to statistical concepts (p-value, Hypothesis Testing, Statistical Inference) and data modeling techniques (Regression, Classification) in Python.\n ● Reviewed the weekly Python homework and projects that are primarily based on Pandas, Matplotlib, and Sklearn for 15 students; Provided feedback for their submissions, leading to enhanced performance in assessments.\n

Research Assistant, Information and Intelligence Group, UIUC

2023 — present

● Developed online assessment and a platform for measuring creativity through three dimensions and its correlation with participants’ interaction with the GPT language models; Ultilized Qualtrics and Python as the main technologies.\n ● Established rigorous guidelines for data cleaning and rating procedures (Pandas, Sklearn, Numpy), ensuring data quality for further analysis and the construction of the list of constant parameters into the platform’s backend.\n ● Implemented systematic checks and improvements by employing the Cohen-Kappa Score to assess mutual rating consistency among different researchers, particularly in the context of pilot study datasets.\n ● Pioneered the application of OpenAI's Ada Model to quantify the semantic distance between alternative usages of experimental-prompt items and their original applications; Evaluated Pearson correlation between the embedding vectors and the quantitative measurement of creativity for further research.\n
